entry.title: Smart Contract Communication
Simple collective decision-making system on Ethereum‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää Part 1
A Complete Intro to Smart Contract Development on the Scroll zkEVM
entry.summary:
I wrote this article as a technical introduction to the Scroll zkEVM for smart contract developers who want to try out the network. In this article, we will: Learn about Scroll zkEVM and how to start with its' Alpha testnet. Set up a dev environment with Foundry and write a smart contract that dispenses ETH on the Alpha testnet based on a pseudo-random number-generating function. Tweak the smart contract to fit in with the exact specifications required for the Alpha testnet Deploy our smart contract with the help of a Solidity script. Verify our smart contract on the Alpha testnet straight out of Foundry's command line. By the end of this article, you will learn how to deploy your smart contracts to Scroll's Alpha testnet with Foundry. What is the Scroll zkEVM?
Scroll zkEVM is a soon-to-l‚Ä¶

entry.title: Secure Your Smart Contract with Diligence Fuzzing
entry.summary: As the Ethereum ecosystem grows, so does the need for secure smart contracts. With billions of dollars locked in DeFi protocols and other decentralized applications, the stakes are high for developers to ensure that their code is free of vulnerabilities. Manual smart contract audits are the gold standard, but demand is high and good auditors are rare. The results are long waiting lists and prices that can quickly reach a six-digit range. An audit is usually performed when the project is mostly finished, and potential security debt has already piled up. On top of that, the human eye is not perfect and might still miss critical bugs; you need more than audits short before launch to secure your locked funds appropriately. This is where security tools come into play. Security best practices ad‚Ä¶

entry.title: How to create a DAO?
DevNTell - Hashleap
entry.summary:
üåà GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, Nasir Jamal (nas) gave us a look at his project, Hashleap: a web3 payments and financial management platform üåü Developer Spotlight Nasir is a software engineer with more than a decade and a half of experience in startups where he held IC and leadership positions. Before HashLeap he cofounded another startup called Rodeo to provide analytics to gig workers for which we raised close to a million dollars led by Seedcamp. He architected and built the first MVP along with the initial engineering team he hired. The company is still going on and his cofounders have gone on to raise another round. Before Rodeo, he was Director of Engineering at Wise and was also one of the first engineers at Deliveroo and helped grow the product team from under 10 to ~400. Throughout his career, he has been involved with early-stage companies with a focus on iterating and delivering products that solve customer problems. üî• About Hashleap From the About section of the Hashleap blog: Hashleap is on a mission to simplify crypto payments for small businesses, web3 companies or freelancers, DAOs and charities by making it part of their business process rather than a disconnected activity. Website: https://hashleap.io/ Blog: https://blog.hashleap.io/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/_nasj Nasir's Twitter: https://twitter.com/hashleap üé• Presentation

entry.title: Maximizing Your AI Experience: How to Prompt Effectively in Midjourney
entry.summary:
If you are starting writing prompts for Midjourney and want to learn how to structure them, Additive Prompting is a simple way to do it. Editorial style photo of 1970 Dodge Charger, low angle camera shot, flames in the background, dramatic light
Midjourney is just one of many AI image generators that have sprung up recently. But unlike its competitors, Midjourney has a more dream-like and artsy style. It's not just about churning out photos - it's more like a painting tool that can help you create something truly unique. If you're into science-fiction or gothic artwork, then Midjourney is perfect. Additive Prompting One of the best ways to use Midjourney is with a technique known as additive prompting. Its a simple way of writing a structured prompt, and it involves creating specific sect‚Ä¶

entry.title: How to Build an NFT Gallery Using QuickNode's GraphQL NFT API
entry.summary:
In this tutorial, you will build an NFT gallery using QuickNode's GraphQL NFT API, Icy.tools, React, JavaScript, Next.js, Vercel, and TailwindCSS. The React web app will provide a user interface displaying a grid view of all the NFTs held by any Ethereum Name Service (ENS). You will fetch NFT data with icy-nft-tools.
What is QuickNode? QuickNode is a blockchain platform that provides infrastructure for developers to build and scale decentralized applications (DApps). It offers a suite of tools and services, including a developer API, to make it easier for developers to build, test, and deploy DApps on multiple blockchain networks. QuickNode aims to simplify the building process on blockchain and make it more accessible for developers while providing high-performance infrastructure to supp‚Ä¶

entry.title: DevNTell - Blocktorch (beta)
entry.summary:
üåà GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, DAO member Gery Pollak gives us an updated look at Blocktorch: an observability platform that helps builders understand the behavior of a decentralized application holistically. üåü Developer Spotlight Gery has 6 years of experience working in business development at FAANG and investing in startups in central & eastern Europe as a VC. He is a self-taught developer (CS50) who made his first steps in solidity development end of 2020 going through the likes of CryptoZombies, Ethernaut, DappUnivserity etc. Beginning of 2022 (at the time when he joined D_D üôÇ ) he started to work on Blocktorch together with his co-founder Amine who is a seasoned software engineer. üî• About Blocktorch From the About page of Blocktorch: The number of decentralized applications, their developers as well as users are growing at rapid speed, yet the tooling around web3 is not evolving fast enough. The underlying decentralized architecture is getting more complex and less understandable. To ensure web3 is mass market ready reliability is key. The talented engineering teams pushing the frontiers of innovation need the best tools to build the best products. We at Blocktorch are re-imagining how developers build and maintain their decentralized applications. We believe in empowering every software engineering team to gain a deeper understanding of their smart contracts as well as other decentralized components such that they can troubleshoot and resolve anomalies in minutes, not hours. Website: blocktorch.xyz Twitter: twitter.com/blocktorch Gery's Twitter: twitter.com/GeryPollak Gery's Discord handle: CapG(blocktorch.xyz)#9916 üé• Presentation
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=stpQ3_Atfnw
